Course Description

This course introduces students to Android application development and design principles. Students will learn the fundamentals of the Android platform, including Activities, Services, Content Providers, and Broadcast Receivers. The course covers UI design with Layouts and Fragments, data persistence, networking, and integration with device features like location and sensors. Students will build several applications throughout the course, culminating in a final project of their choice.

Prerequisites

  • Java Programming (CS 1003)

  • Object-Oriented Design (CS 2001)

  • Data Structures (CS 2010)

Learning Outcomes

Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:

  • Understand the Android application architecture and lifecycle

  • Design and implement user interfaces using XML layouts and Material Design principles

  • Build data-driven applications using SQLite and Firebase

  • Integrate Android apps with REST APIs and cloud services

  • Implement location-based services and device sensors

  • Deploy and publish Android applications to Google Play Store

  • Apply software engineering best practices in mobile development

Course Policies

Attendance Policy

Attendance is mandatory. More than 3 unexcused absences will impact your grade.

Late Work Policy

Assignments submitted late will receive a 10% penalty per day, up to 5 days maximum.

Academic Integrity

All work must be your own. Plagiarism or cheating will result in failure of the course.

Accessibility

Students with disabilities should contact the disability services office for accommodations.
